result.execSummary:
The defendant David L Maxwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David L Maxwell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David L Maxwell was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • David L Maxwell was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

timeConds.notes: Stayed to 12/1/2014 at noon.  Good time credit. Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. stats to apply for work.

Defendant David L Maxwell in court with Attorney Brian Burke.  William Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent Monica Shepherd also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 6 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.   mld

Defendant David L Maxwell in court with attorney Brian B. Burke. Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent Monta Shepherd also in court.
The Court finds that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS of the condition time that was stayed to today's date; the stay on the balance of the time is to continue to the next court date.  Defendant taken into custody.  Filed, signed Order For Commitment Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.  Case adjourned to 6-12-2015 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 4.  mld
Partial refund ordered.

Defendant David L Maxwell in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Bail Forfeiture Hearing proceeds.  In Court is Surety, Al Gabin.  Statements heard from parties.  For the $1,000.00 posted, Court ordered $500.00 bail to be returned to Al Gabin, $500.00 remains forfeited.  For the $200.00 posted, Court orders bail/bond to remain forfeited.
Case is scheduled for BAIL/BOND FORFEITURE HEARING ON 03-06-15 at 9:00 a.m. before Judge Jeffrey Kremers. Notices mailed to defendant and surety.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($1,200 = 1,000 + $200) ad
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant David L Maxwell in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the Court.  AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 48 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:  AS TO COUNT 3:  Court sentenced defendant to serve 3 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 0 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:
- As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending review hearing.
- The Court further ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Corrections with good time credit.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.  Court STAYED sentence to 12/1/2014 at noon.
- Attend and successfully complete Batterer's Intervention Program.
- Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA.
- Attend treatment and counseling programs as determined by agent.
- No Contact with Gabrielle W. without approval of the court.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Obtain/maintain employment and/or education.
- No contact with firearms.
- Restitution is set at zero.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
- Pay all costs, fees and assessments, including DV, VW and DNA, any cash bail to apply.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.   Court ordered case adjourned for probation review hearing in Branch 4.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 03-13-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Based on the numberous Justice Point violations, Court ordered forfeiture of the cash bail in the amount $1,200.00 and set bail in the amount of $3,000.00 with gps supervision, but not at same address.   mld

by the Court to allow the defendant gps release for verified job search, release for verified job and visit with mother at her known address, at twice per week for up to 2 hours.    mld

Defendant David L Maxwell in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 The Hon. Dennis Flynn for the Hon. Mel Flanagan.
Case recalled.  Parties have reached a resolutation.  
Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered dismissal outright of COUNT #1.

  AS TO COUNT #2 and COUNT #3: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 10-6-2014 at 130 pm.  

Court heard and granted the motion of defense with the agreement of the State, to modify the conditions of gps release, to allow defendant release for verified job search, release for verified job and visit with mother at her known address, at twice per week for up to 2 hours.    mld

Defendant David L Maxwell in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Defendant David L Maxwell in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
